when_to_say: when greeting someone
example: Hola, ¿cómo estás? (Hello, how are you?)

when_to_say: when parting ways
example: Adiós, nos vemos mañana. (Goodbye, see you tomorrow.)

when_to_say: when making a request
example: ¿Me puedes ayudar, por favor? (Can you help me, please?)

when_to_say: when expressing gratitude
example: Gracias por tu ayuda. (Thank you for your help.)

when_to_say: when agreeing
example: ¿Quieres ir? Sí. (Do you want to go? Yes.)

when_to_say: when disagreeing
example: ¿Te gusta esto? No. (Do you like this? No.)

when_to_say: when seeking attention
example: Perdón, ¿me puede ayudar? (Excuse me, can you help me?)

when_to_say: when apologizing
example: Lo siento, no quise ofenderte. (I'm sorry, I didn't mean to offend you.)

when_to_say: to describe a state or action
example: Estoy bien, gracias. (I am well, thank you.)

when_to_say: to describe a negative state or action
example: Me siento mal hoy. (I feel bad today.)

when_to_say: to refer to a home
example: Vivo en una casa grande. (I live in a big house.)

when_to_say: to refer to meals or food items
example: Me gusta la comida italiana. (I like Italian food.)

when_to_say: to refer to drinking water
example: Necesito un vaso de agua. (I need a glass of water.)

when_to_say: to refer to a friend
example: Mi amigo es muy divertido. (My friend is very funny.)

when_to_say: to refer to one's family
example: Mi familia es muy unida. (My family is very close.)

when_to_say: to refer to employment or tasks
example: Tengo mucho trabajo hoy. (I have a lot of work today.)

when_to_say: to refer to an educational institution
example: Los niños van a la escuela. (The children go to school.)

when_to_say: to refer to a book
example: Estoy leyendo un libro interesante. (I am reading an interesting book.)

when_to_say: to refer to music
example: Me encanta la música clásica. (I love classical music.)

when_to_say: to refer to a film
example: Vi una película emocionante. (I saw an exciting movie.)

when_to_say: to refer to an urban area
example: La ciudad es muy grande. (The city is very big.)

when_to_say: to refer to a vehicle
example: Tengo un coche rojo. (I have a red car.)

when_to_say: to describe the action of working
example: Voy a trabajar mañana. (I am going to work tomorrow.)

when_to_say: to describe the action of playing
example: Me gusta jugar al fútbol. (I like to play soccer.)

when_to_say: to describe the action of reading
example: Voy a leer un libro. (I am going to read a book.)

when_to_say: to describe the action of writing
example: Escribo una carta. (I write a letter.)

when_to_say: to describe the action of running
example: Me gusta correr en el parque. (I like to run in the park.)

when_to_say: to describe the action of cooking
example: Voy a cocinar la cena. (I am going to cook dinner.)

when_to_say: to describe the action of buying
example: Voy a comprar un regalo. (I am going to buy a gift.)

when_to_say: to describe the action of selling
example: Ella vende frutas en el mercado. (She sells fruits at the market.)

when_to_say: to describe a positive emotion
example: Estoy muy feliz hoy. (I am very happy today.)

when_to_say: to describe a negative emotion
example: Ella está triste porque perdió su libro. (She is sad because she lost her book.)

when_to_say: to describe speed
example: El coche es muy rápido. (The car is very fast.)

when_to_say: to describe speed
example: El tortuga es lento. (The turtle is slow.)

when_to_say: to describe size
example: La casa es grande. (The house is big.)

when_to_say: to describe size
example: El perro es pequeño. (The dog is small.)

when_to_say: to describe appearance
example: El vestido es bonito. (The dress is pretty.)

when_to_say: to describe appearance
example: El edificio es feo. (The building is ugly.)

when_to_say: to describe temperature
example: El café está caliente. (The coffee is hot.)

when_to_say: to describe temperature
example: El agua está fría. (The water is cold.)

when_to_say: to describe difficulty level
example: Este ejercicio es fácil. (This exercise is Easy.)

when_to_say: to describe difficulty level
example: Este examen es difícil. (This exam is difficult.)

when_to_say: to describe someone's intellect
example: Ella es muy inteligente. (She is very intelligent.)

when_to_say: to describe someone's character
example: Él es muy simpático. (He is very nice.)

when_to_say: to describe someone's character
example: La señora es muy amable. (The lady is very kind.)

when_to_say: to describe someone's character
example: Él es muy perezoso. (He is very lazy.)

when_to_say: to describe someone's work ethic
example: Ella es una trabajadora muy dedicada. (She is a very dedicated worker.)

when_to_say: to describe proximity
example: La tienda está cerca. (The store is near.)

when_to_say: to describe distance
example: La playa está lejos. (The beach is far.)

when_to_say: to describe frequency
example: Siempre llego a tiempo. (I always arrive on time.)

when_to_say: to describe frequency
example: Nunca como carne. (I never eat meat.)

when_to_say: to describe frequency
example: A veces voy al cine. (Sometimes I go to the movies.)

when_to_say: to describe the speed of an action
example: Ella corre rápidamente. (She runs quickly.)

when_to_say: to describe a peaceful state
example: El lago es muy tranquilo. (The lake is very calm.)

when_to_say: to describe something unexpected
example: Fue una noticia sorprendente. (It was a surprising news.)

when_to_say: to describe something that captures attention
example: El libro es muy interesante. (The book is very interesting.)

when_to_say: to describe something that is not Easy to do
example: Difícilmente puedo entenderlo. (I can Hardly understand it.)

when_to_say: to describe something extraordinary
example: La vista es increíble. (The view is incredible.)

when_to_say: to describe something that requires effort
example: El examen fue desafiante. (The exam was challenging.)

when_to_say: to describe something delightful
example: El viaje fue maravilloso. (The trip was wonderful.)

when_to_say: to describe something exceptional
example: Su talento es extraordinario. (Her talent is extraordinary.)

when_to_say: to describe the action of vanishing
example: El mago puede desaparecer. (The magician can disappear.)

when_to_say: to describe the action of identifying someone or something
example: No puedo reconocer a esa persona. (I can't recognize that person.)

when_to_say: to refer to the ability to understand
example: La comprensión es clave para aprender. (Understanding is key to learning.)

when_to_say: to explain or detail something
example: Voy a describir mi día. (I will describe my day.)

when_to_say: to clarify or make something understandable
example: Ella va a explicar la lección. (She is going to explain the lesson.)

when_to_say: to refer to a dialogue between people
example: Tuvimos una buena conversación. (We had a good conversation.)

when_to_say: to describe the action of thinking
example: Necesito pensar en eso. (I need to think about that.)

when_to_say: to express belief or opinion
example: Creo que es una buena idea. (I believe it's a good idea.)

when_to_say: to describe emotions or sensations
example: Siento alegría al verte. (I feel joy when I see you.)

when_to_say: to make a choice or conclusion
example: Debo decidir pronto. (I must decide soon.)

when_to_say: to describe the action of finding a solution
example: Necesito resolver este problema. (I need to solve this problem.)

when_to_say: to describe the action of making something better
example: Quiero mejorar mis habilidades. (I want to improve my skills.)

when_to_say: to describe the action of making a change
example: Voy a cambiar mi estilo de vida. (I am going to change my lifestyle.)

when_to_say: to describe the action of adjusting to new conditions
example: Es importante adaptar nuestras estrategias. (It's important to adapt our strategies.)

when_to_say: to describe the action of beginning something
example: Voy a iniciar un nuevo proyecto. (I am going to start a new project.)

when_to_say: to describe the action of completing something
example: Necesito terminar mi tarea. (I need to finish my homework.)

when_to_say: to describe the action of arranging things
example: Voy a organizar una reunión. (I am going to organize a meeting.)

when_to_say: to describe the action of making plans
example: Necesito planificar mis vacaciones. (I need to plan my vacation.)

when_to_say: to describe the action of assessing something
example: Voy a evaluar los resultados. (I am going to evaluate the results.)

when_to_say: to describe the action of researching or examining
example: Voy a investigar este tema. (I am going to investigate this topic.)

when_to_say: to describe the action of growth or improvement
example: Estamos desarrollando una nueva aplicación. (We are developing a new application.)

when_to_say: to describe the action of changing something significantly
example: La tecnología puede transformar nuestras vidas. (Technology can transform our lives.)

when_to_say: to describe the action of making something
example: Vamos a construir una casa nueva. (We are going to build a new house.)

when_to_say: to describe the action of giving or adding to something
example: Todos pueden contribuir al proyecto. (Everyone can contribute to the project.)

when_to_say: to describe the action of encouraging someone
example: Es importante motivar a los estudiantes. (It's important to motivate students.)

when_to_say: to describe the action of putting money into something for profit
example: Decidí invertir en acciones. (I decided to invest in stocks.)

when_to_say: to describe the action of finishing something
example: Necesito completar el informe antes de mañana. (I need to complete the report before tomorrow.)

when_to_say: to describe the action of making an effort
example: Debemos esforzarnos para alcanzar nuestras metas. (We must strive to achieve our goals.)

when_to_say: to describe the action of rebuilding something
example: Tendremos que reconstruir la casa después del incendio. (We will have to reconstruct the house after the fire.)

when_to_say: to describe the action of examining something in detail
example: Voy a analizar los datos del experimento. (I will analyze the data from the experiment.)

when_to_say: to describe the action of combining elements to form a coherent whole
example: Es necesario sintetizar la información para el informe. (It is necessary to synthesize the information for the report.)

when_to_say: to describe the action of making something as effective as possible
example: Debemos optimizar nuestros recursos. (We must optimize our resources.)

when_to_say: to describe the action of assessing the value or quality of something
example: Es importante evaluar el rendimiento del equipo. (It is important to evaluate the team's performance.)

when_to_say: to describe the action of inviting someone to engage in a contest or competition
example: Voy a desafiar a mi amigo a un juego. (I am going to challenge my friend to a game.)

when_to_say: to describe the action of changing the meaning or interpretation of something
example: Es hora de redefinir nuestras metas. (It's time to redefine our goals.)

when_to_say: to describe the action of convincing someone to do something
example: Trato de persuadir a mis amigos a que se unan a la causa. (I try to persuade my friends to join the cause.)

when_to_say: to describe the action of working together with others
example: Vamos a colaborar en este proyecto. (We are going to collaborate on this project.)

when_to_say: to describe the action of introducing new ideas or methods
example: Es fundamental innovar para mantenerse competitivo. (It is essential to innovate to remain competitive.)

when_to_say: to describe the action of causing a dramatic change in something
example: La nueva tecnología puede revolucionar la industria. (The new technology can revolutionize the industry.)
